title: AWS serverless wrapper config schema
description: this schema is for testing a configuration file used to configure the aws_serverless_wrapper

AWS_REGION.description: specified region for AWS computing, normally provided by AWS_CONTEXT -> relevant for testing

UnitTest.description: only used for flagging a test and not running in actual productive code

parse_body.description: if parsing the body for request and response shall be done (handles both)

parse_request_body.description: if parsing the body for request shall be done

parse_response_body.description: if parsing the body for response shall be done

with_context.description: if the aws context shall be passed on into the function

WRAPPER_DATABASE.description: if databases are used by the wrapper configuration is set here

noSQL.description: if a noSQL database shall be configured

RESOURCE_CONFIG.description: optional special configuration of the noSQL resource as specified by AWS

CACHED_TABLES.description:
provide the names of tables to use the cache on
(which have an external hash to verify if data has changed, see examples on how to use it)

API_INPUT_VERIFICATION.description: if input verification from API call shall be considered (e.g. for ReST calls)

LOG_ERRORS.description: if failed validations shall be logged

API_RESPONSE_VERIFICATION.description: if the response from API call shall be checked for fitting response schema (e.g. for ensuring returning correct data)

RETURN_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR.description: if set to true, a missing  (4xx and 5xx statusCodes are excluded and will always be returned)

ERROR_LOG.description: how shall internal errors be logged?

origin.description:
if a schema validation over data shall be done, where does the schema originate from?
file: load schema from a directory
url: load schema from a url
raw: provide the schema directly in this file (or if you access the class handling the validation directly, passing the schema directly to the class

directory.description: the file_path or url of the directory containing the schemas

QUEUE.description: if error log shall be put to a queue, specify queue name here (without stage name)

DATABASE.description: if error log shall be inserted into a database, specify database type and name here (without stage name)

API_RESPONSE.description: if error log shall be returned in request response

LOG_EVENT_DATA.description: if the event data shall be contained in the error log
